thread.title: Gymnastics instructor facing reduced charges in sex case
thread.title_full: Gymnastics instructor facing reduced charges in sex case

title: Gymnastics instructor facing reduced charges in sex case
text:
Gymnastics instructor facing reduced charges in sex case By -   
EAST LANSING, Mich. (AP) - A former Lansing-area gymnastics instructor accused of criminal sexual conduct in connection with a relationship involving a 14-year-old female student is expected to face trial on reduced charges. 
The Lansing State Journal reports (http://on.lsj.com/1PD5KLx ) Mikael Frutin waived his right to a hearing Thursday in District Court in East Lansing to determine whether there’s enough evidence to send the case to trial. 
In court, the prosecution amended the complaint to drop first-degree criminal sexual conduct charges and add third-degree CSC charges. 
Frutin now faces up to 15 years in prison if convicted instead of up to life. His lawyer Nicholas Leydorf declined to comment afterward. 
Police started investigating the case in 2014 and say none of the alleged crimes happened at the gymnastics center in Delhi Township where Frutin worked. 
___ 
Information from: Lansing State Journal, http://www.lansingstatejournal.com
